1.content:
(Just a reminder that this is an Anthro story, so our dear Fluttershy is a Pony-girl, not just a pony, She looks like this:
http://th05.deviantart.net/fs71/PRE/i/20...)

Fluttershy Smiled as she and Zecora sipped tea. Fluttershy loved hanging out with her Zebra friend and wished she could more often. Sadly, the zebra-girl lived in the heart of the EverFree Forest, a wild and hostile jungle on the outskirts of Ponyville. Pony-Girls like Fluttershy often avoided such places but Zecora insisted on a visit. They chatted for a long time, so long that the little yellow pony-girl lost track of time.

"Oh my...." She said looking up at a clock on Zecora's wall. "It's getting really late. I should be going before it gets dark." She said with her ears lowered. Last time she was out when it was dark she was almost dinner for a Timber wolf, a terrbile wolf like creature litterally made out of timber wood.

"I recomend you stay inside, when it gets dark, there is little places to hide." Zecora warned, the zebra-girl almost always spoke in rhyme, though Fluttershy was used to it.

"No that's ok... I know the way home... If I hurry I should be ok." Fluttershy smiled, finished her cup of tea and grabbed her pack. "Thanks for the tea Zecora, it was lovely."

"Please use caution dear Fluttershy. I would be upset, should you die."

Fluttershy frowned but than smiled. "Thanks Zecora." She said as she left.

"Just straight down this path, Straight to the cottage... And I'll be ok." The yellow pony-girl told herself. She swallowed as it got darker and darker all of a sudden. "Oh My... I better hurry... I'm losing track of the path." she said in a worried tone.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
An hour passed and the poor pony-girl was hopelessly lost. "Oh Fluttershy..." She cursed herself. "Why did you think that last turn was a shortcut...."

She looked around worried as she heard sevral noises, natural ones that the forest made reguarly... but somehow these ones sounded more... hungry. And Fluttershy knew in her heart if she didn't hurry, than lost scared pony-girl would be on the menu...

Upon hearing a twig break, Fluttershy let out a scared yell and started running forward. Not watching where she was going she slammed face first into a sign.

"OW!" She said rubbing her face with her hand as she fell backwards onto her butt. She got up slowly and once her vision stoped swirling she looked at the sign.
1.title: The Begining Of Fluttershy's Journey

Fluttershy blinked. "Statue Gardens... I didn't know such a place was around here... Maybe they will have a place where I can rest for the night."

She turned right and started walking down the stone path. She eventually came to a place that was well lit with torches and had hundreds of statues everywhere. She smiled for a momment, thinking it looked lovely, But as she got closer she noticed something. Almost all the statues were of pony-girls and boys, like herself, but that wasn't the worrying part. The worrying part was that almost all of them had looks of shock and terror on their faces, some had looks of confusion, as if sculpted while off gaurd, not a single one seemed to hold an elegant pose. Each stood on a pedastel with no discription as to the artist. What frightened her more was that they were all... every single one of them, Nude. 12222112.content:
I gotta save them! Fluttershy thinks to herself as she runs toward her friend's castle.
Fluttershy is pretty worn out once she reaches the castle. Opening the doors, "Is anypony home?" She echoes throughout the halls.
"Fluttershy?"Twilight comes down the stairs,"I was getting ready for bed. What do you need?"
"I got lost in the Everfree forest. I found my way out eventually, but there is this place called the 'Statue Gardens' and-"
"Statue gardens?"Twilight looks surprised "I thought that was a myth!"
"I found it!" Fluttershy almost panics "And ponies need help! They've been frozen into stone for who knows how long?"
"Let's get the others. We may need their help if the 'Medusa' is still around." Twilight heads for the door. "Spike! Can you watch the tower for a bit? This is important!"
Spike half groans half yells through the halls, "Sure! Don't take too long, please."
Fluttershy and Twilight head to separate parts of town to get the rest quicker. Once they all meet near the Everfree forest, Twilight and Fluttershy explain what happened the best they could.
"Let's go save the ponies!" Pinkie exclaims and starts trotting to the forest.

After a while of re-tracing steps, They finally see the sign again.
"This way!" Fluttershy points in the direction complying with the sign.
They all run all in one little group.

They reach the gardens. Walking through, they notice the similarities between the statues. They all were missing clothing, which shocked the ponies a bit at first, but kept concentrated on the fact that they need help. Most of them were either surprised, scared, or confused.
But Fluttershy notices a couple that are new.
"Whoa..." She whispers "That's new..."
The others gather around the strange sight.

1232322.content:
Fluttershy immediately snaps out of it and shakes her head. Quickly averting her eyes from the painting she takes off in a blind Rush. "Fluttershy you dummy, what's wrong with you... Oh I need to get out of here..." She says as she runs, not paying attention where she's runnign to. After a bit she plows right into someone, knocking both of them over, her on top of him in a very...comprimising position. "Oh...My!' She blushes."I'm so sorry..." She said quickly getting up.

"Not at all, my dear. Completely my fault." The man said getting up. He was a strikingly handsome Pony-Boy, who looked to be about her age. "My name is Upper Class, this is my mansion." he looked over at the shaking girl. "Oh you poor thing. You must be cold in those....drenched clothes. Rather nasty weather we are having... Come. I can offer you food and shelter for the night..." "Oh... Thank you, Mr. Class. I'm Fluttershy." She says blushing. There was something extremely charming about this man... almost too charming. Like every word he spoke sounded like honey to her ears.

"Right this way, Miss Shy. It is Miss, Correct?" "Oh! Yes... I... I am unmarried and single." She blushed playing with her hair... Why did she say that?!

"I find that hard to belive." He said as they walked side by side down the halls of his mansion. "A fetching young thing as your self, has no suitors?"

"Oh... No... I... I mean I'm sure I do... back in ponyville.. Have admirers that is..." She was panting as they walked. Her heart racing. Her mind was telling her she needed to get out, but her heart was telling her to stay longer. "But none of them really...Strike me as mate potential, you know?"

"I do. Alas I too find myself brideless, Since my first wife met with a terrible fate."

"Oh my, What happened to her?"

"She took ill I'm afraid. 3 Years ago." He gestured to a painting on the main hall wall above a fireplace. Fluttershy almost jumped out of her skin. It looked just like her! Though much more royal and regal looking. "Oh MY! She's... She's...."

"Beautiful I know. Sadly she passed and I have this whole place to myself and my servants..." He sighed. "It does get lonely...But look at me, talking to you in such a manner."

"It's fine...I don't mind." She said simply.

"Yes well. To buisness. THis room was once our guest room. In that closet you will find some fresh clothing, you may borrow them while yours dry." He said as he led her into a beautiful room. "I suspiect that my chef shall have dinner ready shortly should you find yourself hungry. I'll leave you to get changed." He said as he closed the doors behind him, leaving Fluttershy alone. As soon as she was sure he was out of earshot she let out a giddy squeal. "Oh my god! He's so handsome!" She blushed hard. "And this place is amazing!" she said looking around. She could get used to living in a place like this.... Wait... Could she? Something felt weird.... Didn't she have a home? She shook off the feeling and went to the closet to fetch the clothes he mentioned and get changed.

choices: It's a creepy cabin.
It's a campsite.
It's a village.
It's an ancient artifact.
It's a monster!
13.content:
Fluttershy’s spirits brightened immediately upon laying eyes on her salvation. A sign! This must mean she’s going in the right direction! Of course, the writing has almost completely faded, as if the sign hasn’t been maintained in decades. Still, the mare was more than content. At this point, she didn’t need to make it back to Ponyville exactly; she would be more than satisfied if she found some sort of shelter or civilization before nightfall. Nighttime is incredibly dangerous in the Everfree; getting lost in the forest at night was almost a death sentence, what with all the Timber Wolves and other monsters that hunt underneath the moon’s light. In fact, when she was young, her parents told her that supernatural creatures and angry spirits also roam the woods during the night, though she was sure these were just rumors. Ghosts don’t exist… right?

She quickly hurried down the dirt path, walking faster and faster as nightfall grew ever closer. Wherever she was heading, she hoped she would make it there soon. As she walked, she thought back on what Zecora had said earlier. “Please use caution dear Fluttershy. I would be upset, should you die." How creepy! And she seemed so casual about it too. Maybe Zecora was used to losing ponies to the Everfree Forest? A few dozen ponies go missing in the forest every year, after all. Fluttershy shuddered at the thought of contributing to that statistic. How careless she had been, trying to make it through the Everfree so late in the evening! She took deep breaths, trying not to panic and lose direction again.

Eventually, through the trees, she manages to see a shadow in the distance. It was only a silhouette, but it was distinct in shape. A smile lit up her face as she saw it. That must be what she was looking for! Maybe there was hope for her after all. She could hardly see anything at this point, so she eagerly drew closer, until she could finally make out what she was looking at....
13.title: Salvation!

choices: She sleeps in the Bedroom.
She sleeps in the Living Room.
She stays awake all night, just in case.
131.content:
She had been anticipating some sort of city, but instead, found shelter; a simple log cabin, far away from society. It looked just as old as the sign did, as if it hasn’t been visited in decades. There were many holes in the walls and tiled ceiling, and the sides were overgrown with vines. At least it’s better than nothing, Fluttershy thought to herself. Though finding this cabin may be a life-saver, she didn’t feel nearly as relieved as she thought she would. Maybe that’s because something about this cabin gave her goose bumps. There was just something off about it. Something… evil. She tries to dispel all the ghost stories she’s heard out of her mind as she hesitantly walks up towards the front door.

Fluttershy knocked on the front door, only for it to slide open by itself. She peered inside, into the pitch blackness of the cabin. It’s certainly as old and abandoned as it looks; everything was covered in cobwebs, and random bits of debris was scattered across the floor. She sneezed a few times just exploring, as she kicked up dust. Luckily, there didn’t seem to be any insects, and she didn’t detect any mold. She smiled, glad to have found shelter at least, but she wasn’t out of danger yet. This cabin was about to fall apart -- she doubted it would stand up against a monster attack. She needed to fortify this place.

Most of the furniture had been chopped to pieces, but she used what hadn’t been to barricade all the entrances, effectively sealing her in. Just in time, too; proper nightfall had just arrived. She shuddered as she heard Timber Wolves howling in the distance as they began their hunt. She laughed to herself as she could finally relax for a while, sitting on the ground to calm her raging heartbeat. She was safe! She had narrowly escaped certain death. First thing tomorrow morning, she would climb up onto the roof and scope out the way back to town. But for now, she just had to relax.

She shivered a bit. The cabin was a blessing, but it still wasn’t the best place to sleep. In the night, it was freezing cold and completely dark. However, fumbling around in the darkness, Fluttershy managed to find a fireplace. Ah! Her good luck continues. She lights the fireplace, which gave just enough heat and warmth to make staying the night a little more comfortable. She sat in front of the fireplace, warming her cold hands over the flames, and yawned. There was a bed upstairs, but the bedroom kind of creeped her out, because for some reason,its walls were absolutely covered in mirrors. She felt much more comfortable in the living room, in front of the fireplace.

She yawned again, interrupting her thoughts. It was late, and she’d had a scary day. She should get some sleep. But where?
131.title: Creepy Cabin!

"F...Fluttershy." She said nervously, not exactly liking where this was going, but the snake did seem nice.

"Nice to meet you Fluttershy, I'm Kaa." He said in a soothing tone.

"H...Hi Kaa... Listen, please let me go. I really need to get home...."

Kaa Chuckled a little "But it's dangerousssss in these woodssss...you could get hurt. Why not ssssstay the night with me... Let me protect you.... You can... Trusssst me...." info.brief_description: Pony-girl Fluttershy is lost in the Everfree forest, Where everything wants her for dinner
info.description:
Fluttershy gets lost in the everfree forest while visiting her friend Zecora. She must find her way home before something finds her...

Fluttershy will encounter all kinds of monsters and baddies this night, including hungry plants and animals, a terrifying Medusa, and a sex-crazed stallion bent on brainwashing her into an obedient little sex slave...

Can she escape or is it this poor yellow pony's fate to wind up never leaving the everfree forest ever again, be it as Food, a statue or a slave...

Her fate is in your hands/hooves..

On a side note, This is an alternate Anthro-World version of the series, So Flutters looks like this:

http://th05.deviantart.net/fs71/PRE/i/2013/015/8/3/fluttershy___anthro_by_tessla...

On that note, Please don't give her feet. She still has hooves as if she were a regular pony, but does have hands. It's just that I find the Anthro-Versions with hooves much cuter.

Fluttershy has two "weapons" at her disposal. One is that she is a pegasus, so she can fly. She just chooses not to due to a fear of hights from years of child trauma and being teased for her flight skills (or lack there of)

She also has the Stare. The details of which are fuzzy, but it seems to give her temporary control over an animal's mind. It can be avoided and canceled out by hypnosis however. Also she refuses to use it on other ponies.

RULES:
This Interactive may include: Soft vore, Cannibalism (not to discriptive), Petrification, And sex.

If you decide to include the CMC it is ok for them to die, but no under age sex will be permited.

Please give Flutters a fighting chance. Each option must give her an escape route, but also one Death/Entrapment/Enslavement ending.

No short paragraph/one senctence posts. Keep them at least 2 paragraphs long.
